intro: Pycnospora, commonly known as the "tree of life," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their woody stems and showy, often fragrant flowers that attract pollinators. Pycnospora species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid climates. Their leaves are usually palmately lobed, and they produce capsules as fruit, which contain numerous small seeds. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their attractive appearance.
